Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member touched a youth's genitals.
Investigation On 6/28/24 Complainant reported to DCWL that Staff 1 touched
Youth A’s genitals. This allegedly occurred on 6/26/24 when Staff
1 went into the lounge area where Youth A was charging his MP3
player. Staff 1 asked Youth A what he was doing, then told Youth
A to leave the lounge area. Staff 1 then rubbed across Youth A’s
penis. Youth A ran out of the building; Staff 1 followed.
Attempts were made to contact Complainant on 6/28/24, 7/8/24,
7/18/24. Although no response was received, additional
information was found in the DHHS intake, which stated Youth A
reported Staff 1 touched his penis, outside of his clothing. This
information was reported by Youth A to an unknown person, who
then reported it to Complainant.
Chief Administrator was interviewed in person on 6/28/24, at the
facility, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator
indicated Youth A made several allegations of this nature in his
prior placement. Chief Administrator reported no concerns with
Staff 1. Chief Administrator provided video of the lounge from
6/26/24.
Youth A was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated that Staff 1
rubbed his hand across the youth’s penis on 6/26/24. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 did not say anything when it happened but
looked at him “weird”. Youth A reported having shorts on that day,
2

without underwear. Youth A stated there were no witnesses
present when this incident occurred in the lounge. Youth A did not
know what time of day this occurred but thought it may have been
at the beginning of Staff 1’s shift. Youth A stated he never had
anything like this happen with Staff 1 or any other staff before.
When asked to provide more detail, Youth A stated he was in the
lounge charging his MP3 player, sitting on the floor. Staff 1 asked
what he was doing. Staff 1 did not tell Youth A to leave. Youth A
stated he was sitting on the floor, crisscross, when Staff 1 bent
down and touched him on the outside of his shorts. Youth A got
up and ran out of the room. Youth A went outside, then came back
in and laid down in his bed. Youth A stated Staff 1 did not chase
him and he has not had any contact with Staff 1 since then. Youth
A stated he did not tell any staff about the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 was informed of the
allegation and stated, “Never. Never ever. That never happened.”
Staff 1 denied having any contact with Youth A on 6/26/24. Staff 1
reported that Youth A had a history of yelling “rape” when upset
with people. Staff 1 gave the example that Youth A became upset
with staff on 6/27/24 and became aggressive. Youth A was with
his one-to-one (1:1) staff (Staff 2), outside of the facility while Staff
1 was on the phone with law enforcement. Youth A began yelling
that Staff 1 was raping him, although Staff 1 was nowhere near
Youth A and Staff 2 was present to clearly see there was no
assault. Youth A indicated he thought the police would hear him
on the phone and believe what he was saying. Youth A told Staff 1
that the police would believe him and Staff 1 would lose
everything. Staff 1 stated he kept his distance from Youth A since
then and will not be alone with him at any time, as he does not
want any allegations made.
Staff 2 was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she was with
Youth A and Staff 1 on 6/27/24. Youth A became upset and
attempted to self-harm outside. Staff 2 was outside as she was
the youth’s 1:1 that day. Staff 1 was also present and called 911.
While on the phone, Youth A began to yell that Staff 1 was raping
him. Staff 2 stated that Staff 1 was more than twenty feet away
and had not touched Youth A. Staff 2 reported she never
witnessed any contact between Youth A and Staff 1.
Staff 2 was not present for the alleged incident on 6/26/24. Staff 2
stated she has never heard any youth report concerns or make
allegations about Staff 1. Staff 2 did not have any concerns about
Staff 1.
3

Foster Care Worker was contacted via email on 6/29/24 and
provided additional information about Youth A. Foster Care
Worker confirmed Youth A had a history of yelling “rape” when
upset. This occurred several times at his previous placement.
Youth A is in need of mental health treatment and has been to the
hospital several times. However, he was always found ineligible
as they determine his actions are behavioral only. A referral was
made for a mental health assessment for Youth A.
Youth B was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B initially refused to
speak with interviewers. However, he did state that he had not
seen any improper actions by staff and there were no problems
with any staff at the facility.
Youth C was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C was not present for
the alleged incident. However, he reported that Staff 1 is a good
staff and he did not have any concerns. Youth C stated he never
witnessed any staff touch youth in a sexual way. Nor has he heard
any youth discuss concerns about staff.
Youth D was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D stated he never saw
any staff have sexual contact with any peers. Youth D did not
have any concerns about Staff 1 and stated he never heard any
peers express concerns about Staff 1.
Youth E was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E stated he never saw
Staff 1 touch any youth in a sexual way. Youth E reported he
never heard of any concerns by peers about Staff 1.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 8/21/2024. Staff 4 worked
with Youth A at his prior placement. In that placement, Youth A
had a history of making false allegations of rape and physical
assault when upset. Staff 4 stated he did not know Staff 1 well.
However, Staff 4 never observed Staff 1 to act inappropriately.
Nor did he hear any concerns from other youth or staff.
Video
Video recording from 6/26/24 was reviewed on-site. The video
showed that Staff 1 entered the lounge area for less than a minute
to assist another youth with a television. There were several youth
and staff present at the time. Staff 1 did not have any contact with
Youth A and was not alone with the youth at any time.
4

Documents reviewed
• A review of Youth A’s case record found there were several
prior investigations at Youth A’s previous placement, where
he alleged rape or improper touch, when he became angry
with staff.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as video review and witness
statements confirm that Staff 1 did not inappropriately touch Youth
A on 6/26/24.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Discipline
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (3) Residents shall not e permitted to discipline other residents.
Description
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff allow peers to physically assault youth.
Investigation On 6/28/24 Complainant reported to DCWL that staff members
direct other children at the facility to physically assault Youth A.
This allegedly happens often and has resulted in scabs on Youth
A’s knees and bruises on his legs. No staff or youth names were
provided. The last reported date of an alleged assault occurred on
6/27/24.
Attempts were made to contact Complainant on 6/28/24, 7/8/24,
7/18/24. Although no response was received, additional
information was found in the DHHS intake, which stated Youth A
reported staff allowed peers to “jump him”, as staff cannot
physically discipline him. Youth A reported having bruises from
these incidents. This information was reported by Youth A to
someone, who then reported it to Complainant.
Youth A was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A had several old marks
on his arms, along with some newer looking scratches on his neck
and arm. Youth A reported that he had cut himself. Youth A also
has a slightly swollen eye and lip. No marks were observed on
Youth A’s legs. Youth A reported that staff allowed Youth B, Youth
C, Youth D, and Youth E to “jump” him during a recent outing to
Metro Beach. Youth A stated he did not hear staff give his peers a
5

directive. However, he felt that Staff 3 and Staff 4 did not prevent
the incident from happening. Youth A reported his peers “jumped”
him while in the bathroom and staff stood outside for 10-20
minutes while it happened. When asked which staff allow peers to
attack him, Youth A stated, “most staff”. Youth A stated he is
attacked almost every day and does not feel safe. When asked
what staff do while he is attacked, Youth A stated that staff try to
break it up and pull kids off one another. Youth A stated Youth B
and Youth C punched him yesterday, resulting in the black eye
and swollen lip.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed on-site at the facility on
6/28/24 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Both staff reported
they had never instructed other youth to discipline or “jump” Youth
A. Both staff stated they had never heard any staff or residents
talk about physically assaulting Youth A. Both staff reported that
Youth A is frequently causing issues with peers by stealing their
belongings and lying to them. This causes the peers to be upset
with Youth A and has resulted in some physical interactions
among the youth. However, staff always step in immediately and
separate the youth. Youth A previously had 1:1 staffing, which
changed to 2:1 staffing recently.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were not present for the outing to the beach.
Staff 3 was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated he never heard
any staff tell youth to attack Youth A. Staff 3 reported he never
heard of any staff at the facility allowing youth to “jump” Youth A.
Staff 3 reported being present for the incident at Metro Beach on
6/22/24. Staff 3 recalled that while they were at the beach, Youth
A took belongings from one peer and put them in Youth E’s bag to
try to frame him. Youth A and Youth E exchanged some words
over the situation but did not get physical. Youth A approached
Staff 3 and asked him to talk with Youth E, as he was afraid Youth
E was going to beat him up. Staff 3 spoke with Youth E, who
assured him that he was not planning on fighting Youth A,
because he wanted to enjoy the time at the beach. Staff 3
encouraged Youth E to ignore Youth A’s behavior, as it would only
get him in trouble if he engaged in anything. Youth E told Staff 3
he would keep his distance from Youth A to avoid trouble.
Staff 3 stated that after the group had finished swimming Youth D
and Youth E went into two-bathroom stalls to change. Staff 3 was
standing outside of the bathroom waiting for both youth. Staff 4
was assigned as Youth A’s 1:1 and instructed him to wait until his
peers came out. However, when Staff 4 bent down to put his
6

shoes on, Youth A ran into the bathroom. Staff 3 followed Youth A
into the bathroom and immediately heard some commotion. Staff
3 observed Youth A, Youth D and Youth E fighting. Staff 4 then
entered the bathroom. Staff 3 separated Youth A and Youth E.
Staff 4 kept Youth D away from both peers. All three of the youth
calmed down quickly and it seemed that they were not going to
have any further issues. Staff 3 observed Youth A to have a black
eye, but no other injuries.
As the group was leaving the beach, Youth A began yelling that
staff were trying to rape, kidnap, and choke him. Youth A laid on
the ground with his hands around his neck yelling, “he’s choking
me”. Law Enforcement arrived and transported Youth A to the
hospital.
Staff 3 stated that Youth A often put himself in situations where he
upset peers by stealing and lying. Staff always stepped in and
assist Youth A when peers became upset with him. Youth A has
not been involved in many fights because staff intervene to protect
him.
Youth B was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B initially refused to be
interviewed. However, once he was asked about Youth A’s lip and
eye Youth B stated that Youth A attacked an autistic child at the
facility and maybe someone did not like what Youth A did. Youth B
confirmed Youth A was punched on 6/27/24 but refused to say
anything more about the incident.
When asked about what happened at the beach, Youth B stated
that he did not see anything as he was busy packing up to leave.
Youth B recalled that staff were at the bathrooms waiting for youth
to change. Youth A was told not to go into the bathroom, because
peers were in there changing. Youth A went in anyway. Youth B
did not see what happened in the bathroom. Youth B stated he
thought one staff was already in the bathroom when Youth A went
in, then another staff entered behind him. Youth B reported the
staff at the facility are great and he never heard staff tell peers to
attack Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported that Youth A
has fought with peers before. Youth E punched Youth A in the
face on 6/27/24. Staff did not tell Youth E to punch Youth A. The
incident occurred as Youth A had stolen an MP3 player and other
belongings from peers. Youth E walked up to Youth A, punched
7

him in the face once and walked away. Staff stepped in and
directed both youth to stay away from one another.
Youth C stated Youth A is always doing things to irritate peers.
However, Youth C never heard staff tell peers to attack Youth A.
Youth C was not present for the incident at the beach.
Youth D was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported he was not
aware of any staff telling or allowing youth to attack Youth A.
Youth D stated he was present for the incident at the beach.
Youth A had stolen belongings from Youth D and put them in
Youth E’s bag, in an attempt to frame him. Youth D and Youth E
discovered what happened and verbally confronted Youth A.
Youth D thought the situation was settled. However, when Youth
D and Youth E were in the restroom area changing, Youth A
walked in. Youth E told Youth A to leave them alone. Youth A
pushed Youth E and they began fighting. Youth D stepped in to
help and Youth A bit his stomach. During the interview Youth D
showed puncture wounds on his stomach that appeared to be
from a bite. Youth D stated he was also hit in the face by Youth A.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 stepped in to break up the fight. Youth D stated
they had been fighting for only a few seconds before staff stepped
in. Staff separated everyone and they all moved back to the car to
leave. At the car, Youth A made threats to get a gun. Youth A was
attacking peers, banging his head on the window, and tried to take
the keys to the car. Staff talked to Youth A and tried to stop him
from banging his head. Youth A began screaming “rape”. Law
Enforcement arrived to assist and took Youth A to the hospital.
Youth E was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported that he never
heard staff tell youth they can or should physically assault Youth
A. Staff tell youth to ignore Youth A’s behaviors, as he is often
trying to do things to irritate others, and they would feed into it.
Regarding the incident at the beach, Youth E reported that Youth
A took some of Youth D’s belongings and put them in a Youth E’s
bag, then told Youth D that Youth E stole the items. Youth E was
mad about the situation but decided to walk away and go to the
bathroom to change. Youth E heard staff tell Youth A he needed
to wait until Youth E came out of the bathroom before he could go
change. When Youth E went into the bathroom, Youth D was
already in there. Youth A then walked into the bathroom, angry,
yelling, and swearing. Youth E stated he tried to remain calm, but
Youth A pushed him into the wall. Youth E tried to hit Youth A, but
Youth A bit his face and chest. Bite marks were observed on
8

Youth E’s ribs and chin during the interview. Staff 3 came in and
separated Youth A and Youth E. Youth D was assisted by Staff 4.
Staff 3 then blocked Youth A from having access to either peer
and tried talking to him. However, Youth A pushed through staff
and punched Youth E again. Youth E knocked Youth A to the
ground, before staff could get in between them again. Staff were
able to separate and deescalate both youth. The group then
packed up and started getting into the car. Youth A ran from staff,
refusing to get in, then suddenly ran at Youth E and pulled him out
of the car. Youth E reacted by punching Youth A in the mouth,
knocking him to the ground. Staff separated the youth again.
Youth A began punching staff, spitting at everyone, yelling rape,
and attempted to take the van keys. Staff 3 and Staff 4 put Youth
E in a standing hold when he was trying to hit his head on the van
window. The hold did not last long, as Youth A was fighting staff
and they let go. Youth E states someone called the police, but he
was not sure who. When the police arrived, Youth A said that staff
hit him and raped him in the bathroom. Youth E said he was
feeling very protective over staff and spoke up to tell the police
nothing like that happened.
Youth E stated there were three staff and six youth on the outing.
Staff did the best they could to manage the situation, but Youth A
made everything very difficult.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 8/21/2024. Staff 4 did not
regularly work at this facility. However, he volunteered to assist
with the Metro Beach outing on 6/22/24. Staff 4’s account of the
incident at Metro Beach was consistent with the information
provided by Staff 3, Youth B, Youth D, and Youth E. Staff 4
indicated Youth A was the antagonist throughout the day and staff
were quick to intervene each time.
Staff 4 stated he never heard anyone tell youth to attack Youth A
and never observed any staff to allow youth to fight. Staff 4 denied
hearing any youth indicate staff told them to “jump” Youth A.
Staff 4 stated he knew Youth A prior to this outing, due to his
previous placement. In that placement, Youth A had a history of
making false allegations of rape and physical assault when upset.
Documents Reviewed:
• 6/22/24 Incident report written by Staff 3. Indicated that
Staff 3 heard Staff 4 tell Youth A not to go into the
bathroom. Staff 4 bent down to put his shoes on and Youth
A ran into the bathroom. Staff 3 followed Youth A into the
bathroom and found Youth A on top of Youth E, biting him
9

in the chest. Youth D was punching Youth A in the side.
Staff 3 stepped in to separate the youth. Staff 4 entered the
bathroom and assisted in separating the youth. Staff then
walked with youth to the car. Youth A then made death
threats toward other clients, picked up sticks, trash cans
and other items to try to harm peers with. Staff 3 and Staff
4 blocked Youth A from harming other youth. Youth A then
began banging his head on the window and put a rubber
band around his neck. Staff removed the rubber band.
Youth A screamed false allegations including rape, choking
and kidnapping. Youth A tried to take the keys to the car.
Youth A then began punching and hitting staff and youth.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 placed Youth A in a high, sitting hold for
approximately twenty seconds. Staff let go as Youth A was
swinging, kicking, and pulling away. Staff flagged down a
police car and they intervened. Youth A was transported to
the hospital by law enforcement. Staff 3 observed Youth A
to have a black eye as a result of the incident with Youth D
and Youth E.
• 6/22/24 Hospital discharge paperwork did not have any
instructions, diagnosis, or injuries documented. Youth A
arrived at the hospital around 9:00pm; discharged at
11:00pm. CT scan completed for head injury indicated the
results were “normal”.
• A review of Youth A’s case record showed nineteen
incident reports since placement at the facility on 6/13/24.
The incidents include AWOL, assault, suicidal behavior,
self-injurious behavior, property damage, and arrest. The
incident reports of assault indicate Youth A was the
instigator in situations, not the target.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as all staff and youth
interviewed reported that no youth were given instructions or
permission to physically assault Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
10

rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth intentionally cut himself with glass while staff were present.
Investigation On 6/28/24 Complainant reported that law enforcement
responded to the facility on 6/27/24 for a suicide in progress.
Youth A had cut his left forearm with a piece of glass and was
having suicidal ideations. Youth A was transported to the hospital.
An email from Foster Care Worker on 6/28/24 stated that Youth
A has behavioral issues and can become agitated quickly. Youth
A will then lash out verbally and physically.
Youth A was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A had several small
scars on his arms, along with some newer looking scratches on
his neck and left arm. The scratches on his neck and arm were
observed to be superficial and healing. Youth A reported that he
had caused the injuries to his arm and neck. Youth A stated he cut
himself while outside. Youth A had walked away from the building
and found a piece of broken glass on the ground. Youth A
returned to the side of the building and scratched his left forearm.
Youth A stated Staff 2 was with him while he was scratching
himself. Staff 2 was talking to him, but he could not remember
what she said. At one point an ambulance arrived and took him to
the hospital. Youth A did not recall any other staff or youth present
during that incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 was present for the
incident on 6/27/24. Staff 1 stated that Staff 2 was the assigned
1:1 staff for Youth A that day. Staff 1 became involved when Staff
2 called for assistance. Staff 1 walked outside and observed
Youth A with a small piece of glass in his hand, scratching himself.
Youth A was unable to fully cut himself due to the glass being
small and dull. Youth A reportedly found the glass in the road.
Staff 2 gave several verbal prompts for Youth A to put the glass
down, but he would not cooperate. Staff 2 also asked Youth A to
go inside, but he was refusing to follow directions. Staff 1 called
911 and an ambulance transported Youth A to the hospital.
Staff 2 was interviewed on-site at the facility on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 was the assigned 1:1
staff for Youth A on 6/27/24. Youth A was upset that day because
11

he thought someone had gone into his room. However, no one
had been in his room. Staff 2 tried to talk Youth A through this
situation, but he would not listen and ran outside. Staff 2 followed
Youth A. Youth A walked on and off the property, then picked up
something in the street. Staff 2 observed it to be a very small
glass piece. Youth A began scratching his arm with the glass, but
he was unable to cut himself. Staff 2 called Staff 1 for assistance.
Staff 2 told Youth A to stop and took the glass from him. Youth A
immediately picked up another small piece of glass. Staff 2 asked
Youth A what they could do to help him, asked if he wanted a
snack, asked if he would like to go do an activity. Youth A stated
he wanted to kill himself because people were trying to fight him.
Youth A would not identify who the people were. Staff 1 then
arrived and called 911. While Staff 1 was on the phone, Youth A
began screaming that Staff 1 was raping him. Staff 2 stated that
Staff 1 was about twenty feet away from Youth A and not touching
him. Youth A continued to yell. Staff 2 attempted to talk with Youth
A and redirect him until the ambulance arrived and took him to the
hospital. Staff 2 did not recall any other youth or staff present at
the time of the incident.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on-site on 6/28/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief Administrator reported
that after returning from the hospital, 2:1 staffing was put in place
for Youth A. It was determined this staffing ratio was necessary to
prevent Youth A from harming himself, but also to provide
additional supervision should Youth A report further allegations
against staff.
Documents Reviewed
• 6/27/24 incident report authored by Staff 2 was consistent
with the information she reported during the interview.
• 6/27/24 Hospital discharge paperwork did not have any
instructions or diagnosis. Youth A arrived at the hospital at
11:53pm on 6/27/24. Youth A was discharged 6/28/24 at
9:45AM.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as Youth A was sufficiently
staffed and staff intervened appropriately by using discussion,
removing the object, redirection, and calling for assistance.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
12

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
